etymology.description: 发(發) + 呆 = show/emit dullness → be in a daze.
etymology.interpretation: Indicates slipping into a blank, unresponsive state; zoning out or staring absentmindedly.
etymology.simplification: 發 → 发 was simplified via a common cursive abbreviation to reduce strokes and merged with 髮; 呆 stayed the same.

parts.english: to send out; to emit; to issue; to develop

examples.chinese: 他在窗前发呆(他在窗前發呆)。
examples.english: He stared off by the window.

examples.chinese: 上课时我不小心发呆了(上課時我不小心發呆了)。
examples.pinyin: Shàngkè shí wǒ bù xiǎoxīn fādāi le.
examples.english: I zoned out in class by accident.

examples.chinese: 别发呆，快点走吧(別發呆，快點走吧)。
examples.pinyin: Bié fādāi, kuài diǎn zǒu ba.
examples.english: Don't space out; hurry up and go.
